title: How to Set Up a Blu–ray Player

steps.headline: Unpack your Blu-ray player.
steps.description: Look for a power cord and a HDMI cable. If it doesn't have a HDMI cable, you can use a color-coded RCA cable to connect the TV in the meantime. Opt to order an HDMI cable from an online retailer if you don't have one, since they provide the best connection to your devices.

steps.headline: Find a wall outlet for your Blu-ray player.
steps.description: It must reach between your TV console and the wall. Plug the power plug into your player.

steps.headline: Connect one end of the HDMI cable to the back of your Blu-ray player.
Insert the other end into the HDMI port in the side or back of your HDTV.

Use the colors to connect the red, white and yellow plugs on the RCA A/V cable with the back of your Blu-ray player and the back of the TV if you have chosen to use this type of cable instead of the HDMI cable.
steps.description: Don't forget to insert the audio cable into your player and TV.

steps.headline: Grab your TV's remote control.
steps.description: Find the “input” button. Input indicates what device is being shown on your TV.

steps.headline: Choose the input that corresponds with the type of port you used.
steps.description:
For example, if you plugged the cable into the HDMI-2 port in the side of your TV, the input will be labeled “HDMI-2.”
If you used an RCA cable, it is likely to say “Video-1.”
Test all the inputs by pressing the input button until you have tried them all. Wait a few seconds between switching the input so that you can find the one that shows your Blu-ray player menu.

steps.headline: Insert a Blu-ray into the player using the buttons on the outside of the device.
steps.description: Load it and allow it a few seconds to read the disk.

steps.headline: Use the buttons on your remote or the remote that came with your Blu-ray player to control the play, stop, pause, rewind and fast-forward settings.
steps.description: Press the menu button to access the main menus.

steps.headline: Connect your Blu-ray player to the Internet if it is an Internet device.
steps.description: In the Blu-ray menu find an option to connect it to your wireless network. Once you type in your network name and password, you may be able to rent movies and stream them directly from your Blu-ray player. You can also connect it to your modem using an Ethernet cable.

steps.headline: Set the aspect ratio on your TV to a rectangular shape.
steps.description: Find the setup button on your remote. Choose the 16:9 ratio.

steps.headline: Set the resolution on your TV.
steps.description: Press the setup button on your remote. Choose 1080 resolution if it is available on your TV, since that is the resolution of a standard Blu-ray.

text:
Preparing For Installation Unpack your Blu-ray player. Look for a power cord and a HDMI cable. If it doesn't have a HDMI cable, you can use a color-coded RCA cable to connect the TV in the meantime. Opt to order an HDMI cable from an online retailer if you don't have one, since they provide the best connection to your devices. Find a wall outlet for your Blu-ray player. It must reach between your TV console and the wall. Plug the power plug into your player. Turn your TV off.  Connecting the Electronics Connect one end of the HDMI cable to the back of your Blu-ray player.  Insert the other end into the HDMI port in the side or back of your HDTV.  Use the colors to connect the red, white and yellow plugs on the RCA A/V cable with the back of your Blu-ray player and the back of the TV if you have chosen to use this type of cable instead of the HDMI cable. Don't forget to insert the audio cable into your player and TV. Turn on the Blu-ray player.  Turn on your TV.  Setting Up the Blu-Ray Player Grab your TV's remote control. Find the “input” button. Input indicates what device is being shown on your TV. Choose the input that corresponds with the type of port you used. For example, if you plugged the cable into the HDMI-2 port in the side of your TV, the input will be labeled “HDMI-2.”
If you used an RCA cable, it is likely to say “Video-1.”
Test all the inputs by pressing the input button until you have tried them all. Wait a few seconds between switching the input so that you can find the one that shows your Blu-ray player menu. Insert a Blu-ray into the player using the buttons on the outside of the device. Load it and allow it a few seconds to read the disk. Use the buttons on your remote or the remote that came with your Blu-ray player to control the play, stop, pause, rewind and fast-forward settings. Press the menu button to access the main menus. Connect your Blu-ray player to the Internet if it is an Internet device. In the Blu-ray menu find an option to connect it to your wireless network. Once you type in your network name and password, you may be able to rent movies and stream them directly from your Blu-ray player. You can also connect it to your modem using an Ethernet cable. Adjusting TV Settings Set the aspect ratio on your TV to a rectangular shape. Find the setup button on your remote. Choose the 16:9 ratio. Set the resolution on your TV. Press the setup button on your remote. Choose 1080 resolution if it is available on your TV, since that is the resolution of a standard Blu-ray.
